docs.lead_paragraph: 8 P.M. (ABC) DREAMS COME TRUE: A CELEBRATION OF DISNEY ANIMATION Vanessa Williams holds court at this retrospective of 75 years of Disney silver-screen wizardry, crowned by a look at the company's newest animated film, ''The Princess and the Frog,'' above, featuring the voices of Anika Noni Rose, Terrence Howard and Emeril Lagasse, and music by Ne-Yo. The hourlong tribute includes reminiscences about favorite Disney moments from a starry roster of celebrities -- among them, Miley Cyrus, Whoopi Goldberg, Jamie Lee Curtis, Selena Gomez, Kristin Chenoweth, Elton John, Magic Johnson, Dick Van Dyke, Sigourney Weaver, Betty White, Serena Williams and Anjelica Huston. 9 A.M. docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Barbara A. Mikulski, Democrat from Maryland and the main sponsor of a women's health amendment approved by the Senate, went to great lengths on Thursday to make sure fellow lawmakers recognized the differences between her proposal and a rival one put forward by Senator Lisa Murkowski, Republican of Alaska. Given their similar-sounding names, Ms. Mikulski also wanted to see that no one confused her with her Republican colleague.
docs.abstract: Democratic Sen Barbara A Mikulski, who is main sponsor of women's health amendment approved by Senate, goes to great lengths to make sure fellow lawmakers recognize differences between her proposal and rival one put forward by Republican Sen Lisa Murkowski, which was not approved; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: No matter what legislators are fighting about on the Senate floor, two issues in the health care debate will be key to the final outcome: insurance coverage for abortion and a proposed government-run health insurance plan, or public option. Neither issue has figured greatly in the Senate floor debate so far, behind the scenes in the Capitol they are the issues that senators, particularly Democrats, are talking about more than any others.

headline.main: Two Issues Hold Key In Senate Health Votes
